author: ashpool37
content: Evening everyone ðŸ™‚  I'd like to contribute to the project any way I can as a DevOps engineer. I have experience troubleshooting p2p nodes (incl. Ethereum) at P2P Validator, setting up monitoring, providing analytics and automating stuff. I'll be watching this channel pro-actively, and please let me know whenever there's anything you think I can help with!

author: protolambda
content: Great, once we get to the first devnets/testnets devops help is appreciated, and maybe there is more you and other new contributors can help with as well

author: protolambda
content: We should organize some call for the early-birds who want to get involved, but I am not sure about a date or time yet

author: trent_vanepps
content: i'd love to be involved with keeping the broader community involved / aware throughout the month and coordination in general

author: protolambda
content: <@!420951281910284289> That would be very helpful. Currently I think we should organize some early-bird call where we can coordinate with others to make the most out of the early resources/time we have until the hackathon. And then start something more similar to office-hours, like a call at a set time every other day that's optional, and at least me and maybe a few others others will be able to discuss the latest things?

author: trent_vanepps
content:
sounds great!

another idea is a weekly public livestream depending on how much interfacing with the external community we want. could be something exciting that people can tune into to catch the updates from the week

edit: i'm suggesting this for during the hackathon, or biweekly

author: potuz
content: If there's place/use for me I'd also love to be involved. I have no qualifications other than being a curious guy and being acquainted a little bit with prysm's codebase and the eth2 specs (although at the current pace of development I'm falling behind)

author: protolambda
content: For everyone interested in Rayonism and available before the hackathon: we are **looking to organize a call next week** where we go over what can be done in preparation. I want to avoid conflicts with other calls/obligations for everyone as much as possible. Also, I think we may want to change to a different time of day than eth 'o clock, since we've a lot of interested folks in PT timezone, or close to that. I'll post some suggestions below, add a discord emoji and we'll see what works best.

author: protolambda
content: Numbered them, added a vote for each, should be a simple click of an emoji button now.
